discourse_list.title: Growth CU weekly update: September 17 - September 23

content.content: General Updates  RWAs in other geographies. For the last months, we have been working with the @Real-World-Finance team, passing them opportunities of originators from different geographies (Europe and Singapore) to find the best structure for them and post their proposal. As we have seen, onboarding RWAs is a complex challenge, and its difficulty increases when you include various countries.  Grayscale’s Deeper Dive into MakerDAO with Rune Don’t miss @rune  on September 29, 2021, at 10:00 AM EDT, discussing his vision for MakerDAO, explaining how the protocol works, and MakerDAO’s use cases. Location: Webinar via Zoom link here.  Contractors/freelancers receiving their payments in DAI Due to the devaluation of the local currencies, people are looking to work for companies abroad and receive their compensation in DAI. We are working closely with BitWage and DefiantApp to explain how they can receive, save and use their DAI. That’s the reason why Layer2 and sidechain wallets are so popular between them. Since a considerable part of these independent contractors receives their payments in DAI, it’s pretty common for them to pay directly instead of converting it into the local currency. This week @Lozadaluis12  talked in a webinar for entrepreneurs to explain to them how to start using DAI.   Star-s- of the week   Pawn.fi is a new NFT lending protocol where you can use your NFTs to borrow ETH or DAI. DAI integrated on Wirex X-Accounts offering with 16% yield. Available in Europe (x-UK) and APAC (x-Singapore).  Tweet of the Week   twitter.com    MakerDAO Growth @MakerGrowth    1/10  Hey @xdaichain, let's take a look on your ecosystem 👀  Metrics, TVL, protocols from the blockchain for stable payments that can process fast and inexpensive transactions using Dai as a gas token 😎  👇 https://t.co/EaQwiAMqKr   7:32 PM - 21 Sep 2021           92                29

Nadia:  DAI integrated on Wirex X-Accounts  offering with 16% yield. Available in Europe (x-UK) and APAC (x-Singapore).   Wow, that’s great news, somewhere along my crypto journey I know that WIREX allowed to get physical cards, so I guess this is one of the few ways to spend DAI with physical cards, right?

discourse_list.title: Growth CU weekly update: September 24 - September 30

content.content: General Updates  China. Due to the recent policy changes in China, all the CEX are moving away from the centralized paradigm (focusing on the NFT marketplace and DeFi) or looking for a new country to relocate their business. The initiatives we had with China companies are paused while they find a way to continue their business. One example of this movement is OKex. Jocelyn is working with them to integrate DAI in their network (similar to the Binance strategy). They are working in the okex bridge (decentralized bridge) which is still in testnet, EVM compatible. They’re also building a DeFi Hub, a DeFi asset management dashboard similar to zapper.fi and zerion.  Gamers and DAI. As we mentioned before, we are working with various blockchain games and tournament platforms to incorporate DAI, as an in-game currency or through tournament prizes. This initiative helped us to develop a DAI for gamers strategy that includes:  Earn Dai: Generate awareness through tournament prizes Spend Dai: Partnership with pay-with-crypto platforms where players can buy skins or subscriptions to gaming platforms with Dai. Talk about Dai: In the tournaments we sponsor, we ask the streamers to talk about Dai.  Las tournament we sponsored was the Lunacian Latin Invitational (LLI), the biggest eSports tournament of Axie Infinity in Latin America organized by Block Esports. Alongside this partnership, we did an amazing marketing promotion with one of the biggest Spanish YouTubers that participated in the tournament, Reven.  twitter.com    Reven @Reventxz    El próximo 9 de Octubre voy a participar en el mayor torneo hispanohablante de Axie Infinity por más de 18.000$ en premios contra los mejores jugadores de la escena  Gracias @BlockEsportsLA por la oportunidad https://t.co/6QW4Nqmjv2   9:54 PM - 26 Sep 2021           520                76            In this Twitch Clip, you can see how Reven talks about how he got paid in DAI. He has almost 1M users followers on Twitch.  PR agency. We are talking with various PR agencies that have a worldwide presence to pass them the big news we think everyone should know about Maker. Things like the inclusion of SolarX as collateral in the protocol are something we feel deserves attention. Let us know if you know an agency that could help us with this.   Star-s- of the week   DAI is Live on the CryptoMKT exchange. In the following weeks, they will launch an education campaign within their users and incentives to increase DAI usage. CryptoMKT is one of the biggest exchanges in LATAM, and its primary focus is Chile. They also operate in Argentina and Brazil. The trading platform Woo network listed DAI.  Tweet of the Week Thanks @Primoz for the inspiration   twitter.com    MakerDAO Growth @MakerGrowth    1/13  🤔 Still looking at TVL? You probably are missing a big chunk of important data.  Be like the Capybara (and the girl), focus on organic GROWTH.    A thread of best data boards for looking at Maker & DeFi metrics here 👇🧵 https://t.co/o4y09iblj6   7:52 PM - 28 Sep 2021           140                36

discourse_list.title: Growth CU weekly update: July 23 - July 29

content.content: General Updates  PSM delay Update. Paxos will post about the Maker-Paxo partnership towards including PAX in the PSM. This agreement includes adding DAI to the Paxos Platform, which unlocks the below user flows:  User can swap supported fiat currencies for DAI using the PSM (if best market rate) User can custody DAI User can buy/sell crypto using DAI User can deposit/withdraw DAI  These will be available directly on the Paxos.com platform or via API through our Crypto Brokerage product.   Star-s- of the week   DAI has been activated in Binance pay. With Binance Pay you can shop with DAI or send money to friends and family worldwide. In mid-August, Binance will merge Binance pay with Binance P2P, adding a flexible on-off ramp to the platform. Binance pay currently has 2million users. Dai was part of the first NFT collection by Damien Hirst called “The Currency”, a collection of 10,000 nfts that correspond to 10,000 unique physical artworks. Launched on the Palm network, a new Ethereum side chain that supports Dai. Attention CUs  SuperFluid, a streaming real-time payments protocol, is live with Dai. They support use cases like paying salaries, subscriptions payments, rewards, and other perpetual payment types.  Tweet of the week   twitter.com    MakerDAO Growth @MakerGrowth    1/18  🤝 Delegation will arrive to MakerDAO on August 2nd, 2021. You will be able to delegate your MKR to "your delegate" for voting in governance, just in case you want to, for whatever reason you see fit. Let's explain how it will work and why is important to Maker governance: https://t.co/eRtYGsfidN   3:47 PM - 26 Jul 2021           99                21

Nadia:  Attention CUs  SuperFluid, a streaming real-time payments protocol, is live with Dai. They support use cases like paying salaries, subscriptions payments, rewards, and other perpetual payment types.   That already existed for quite some time natively with xDAI, in fact I received xDAI and some airdrops pair tokens for it. Does it already work natively with Ethereum DAI?

Nadia:  Paxos will post about the Maker-Paxo partnership towards including PAX in the PSM   I can’t wait to see the details, but I think there’s a lot of potential value for both parties if we do this right. Fantastic work.

PaperImperium:  I can’t wait to see the details, but I think there’s a lot of potential value for both parties if we do this right. Fantastic work.   I swear, just the thought of an exit to fiat with DAI using PAX blows my mind.
Yes, also on Polygon and Ethereum native (re: Superfluid)

Good stuff—a lot of chatter this week with Mercado Bitcoin raising tons of money from SoftBank and Lemon Cash out of Argentina also gaining traction. I was wondering if DAI is available in these two trending applications, and if so, any upcoming campaigns with either one?—especially Lemon since it’s getting traction in Argentina which I hope is still DAI strong. Thank you in advanced. -El Pro

Yep, both Dai and MKR are available on Mercado Bitcoin. Btw, did you know the CEO of Lemon Cash wrote about Maker and Dai back in 2018? Interesting read. Ethereum based stable coin is killing traditional bank loans: Ladies and Gents meet Dai

@flipflopflapdelegate are you reading our minds? @Lozadaluis12 is working with Mercado Bitcoin  and Lemon Cash   in the launching of a campaign with them to increase Dai awareness on those platforms. Shout out to Luis!!!
Great minds think alike, all good vibes to Luis, a hard worker.

discourse_list.title: Growth CU weekly update: July 2 - July 8

content.content: General Updates  Dai liquidity in other networks. When talking with a protocol on another network about integrating Dai, they sometimes ask for help to inject Dai liquidity into the protocol to bootstrap the market. Depending on the depth needed and the size of the protocol, Dai needed for liquidity could be about 3MM. Usually, these pools generate fees from trades that will provide revenue. Still, there’s always the risk associated with the impermanent loss if the pool is not against another stablecoin (and the risk of the protocol itself). There are different solutions for this:  companies that provide Market Maker services (for a fee) Other DAOs have a treasury A loan from any of the lending protocols (for a fee)  We will be posting an extended analysis of this to find the right solution for this challenge.  MakerDAO is part of the EEA. The Enterprise Ethereum Alliance (EEA) is an organization whose objective is to drive the use of Ethereum. As members, we have exposure to the other members and access insights into what companies are looking for. This is also another channel to communicate what MakerDAO is doing.   Star of the week   Marble cards Arena will launch next week: what if you could convert your favorite forum post or executive vote into a NFT and play with it….  Tweet of the week   image1172×1384 202 KB   June’s PnL  1116×1120 149 KB

Great to see actual expenses coming in so close to the budget, great work Nadia  . Have you had a chance to review the entity structure for real world assets here? Would love to know if this would work for investing with Circle as discussed in the growth update a couple weeks ago.

discourse_list.title: Growth CU weekly update: July 9 - July 15

content.content: General Updates  Offboarding Collaterals. We are reaching out to the issuers of the tokens we plan to offboard and conversing with them to get feedback and understand why they or their token holders are not using Maker Vaults. We have spoken with Brave, Loopring, Decentraland, Kyber and waiting to talk with 0x. The feedback we are getting is similar from all the teams:  They want to maintain their position as collateral They (as a project) are not using Maker Vaults for different reasons (their treasury is for helping them to grow, so they use it in their partners and marketing, they are defining how to manage their treasury, their treasury team is not aware of the current risk parameters) They are interested in having special terms for their vault  These conversations are taking longer than expected because the decision to open a Vault to take the remaining DC requires time. We explain to them that we will be waiting until September 1st to see if the utilization of the vault changed and that that will be taken into account when the community decides what the next steps are.  Institutional Vaults. We are talking with a large custody platform and ​​a major digital asset trading platform about Maker Vaults. We have their interest, and if we can have them opening vaults, that will increase Dai supply and reduce our USDC exposure. What do we want to do to achieve this:  We need the institutional vault product asap. Growth, PE, Risk CUs, and Nexo are working together on the proposal of this product. We need to solve the KYC part. We are working with our legal counsel to understand these companies’ requirements and determine what kind of structure we need to incorporate or with whom we need to partner to solve it. Institutions have off-chain requirements: like the one-to-one relationship to set agreements and a larger liquidation window.   PSM delay Update.     [Signal Request] Should we delay the governance poll related to adding PAX-GUSD-BUSD to PSM? Signal Archive       UPDATE PAXOS  The Paxos team told us that they are very interested to be part of the maker Ecosystem and they will be posting in two weeks a draft regarding the following.   Total capital commitment to put in the PSM. Tranches and conditions to form the total capital. How Dai is going to be implemented in their systems and products. Overall agreement  The most important thing for us is that they build a process inside their systems for their clients to mint Dai. This process must involve the use…      Join the conversation.     Question about future products Proposal Ideas       At Maker growth we are always trying to find ways to grow the protocol, both through partnerships and through the creation of new products (example institutional vaults), and following this line, I have been thinking lately several examples of products of which I would like to know the opinion of the community about it.  ETH Staking Services by MakerDAO ™: It is known to many that ethereum staking services can and will capture a large portion of eth’s working capital in the long run, this leaves…         Dai liquidity in other networks Growth       Opening a new market for Dai (and MKR, but this post is to talk about Dai) requires the interest of the project/network/Dapp/etc. -partner- in integrating Dai. This interest comes from the analysis of knowing that integrating Dai will help them attract more users and improve the usability of their product.  Once Dai is integrated into the product, it requires a market capable of fulfilling users’ requests. Although Dai liquidity grows in time, there has to be someone deploying the initial capita…       Star of the week   EPNS+Oasis Oasis.app users will receive notifications that would help them to manage their Maker Vaults, including:  When the Vault might be at risk of liquidation on the next price update due to a sudden price drop When the Vault has reached a certain collateralization ratio that you’d like to take a certain action at, either to buy additional collateral, or repay. When risk parameters, such as Stability Fee’s or Debt Ceiling changes are made by Maker Governance that affect a Vault you own.   Tweet of the week   twitter.com    MakerDAO Growth @MakerGrowth    1/16 Do you have concerns about these charts? ⬇️ Dai's collateralization implies a lot of factors to study. We'll explain what are the differences between these charts below and what factors do you need to know to understand Dai dynamism. https://t.co/hEV6Qge3E4   3:09 PM - 15 Jul 2021           37                15             Join us at EthCC   twitter.com    EthCC - Ethereum Community Conference @EthCC    🤩 #EthCC Speakers 🤩 @GArentoft from @MakerDAO  20-22 July 2021 Decentralised Finance https://t.co/ojdNEbKsO7   12:05 PM - 14 Jul 2021           11                1              twitter.com    EthCC - Ethereum Community Conference @EthCC    🤩 #EthCC Speakers 🤩 @nad8802 from @MakerDAO  20-22 July 2021 Governance / DAO https://t.co/cI8m1eGWXd   9:40 AM - 14 Jul 2021           22                2               Eventbrite    Keeping Up With The Maker Mafia Join us and catch up with the Maker Community!

Nadia:  We need to solve the KYC part. We are working with our legal counsel to understand these companies’ requirements and determine what kind of structure we need to incorporate or with whom we need to partner to solve it.   Are these requirements generally regulatory in nature, or for their own internal risk management? Is there likely to be a solution that will work for most (or all) of these institutions? Or are their needs diverse?

In a set up where a platform (ie. custody provider, digital asset mgmt platform) wants to provide institutional vaults as a service within their offerings, where their clients can opt-into the vault via that platform provider, that platform provider needs to have an entity on our side to KYC in order to deploy their clients funds into a institutional vault. They also want to have internal risk mgmt for their own due diligence to feel comfortable with our smart contract risk, liquidations and other risk parameters, to open it to their customers.

Nadia:  We need to solve the KYC part. We are working with our legal counsel to understand these companies’ requirements and determine what kind of structure we need to incorporate or with whom we need to partner to solve it.   Would Fireblocks + incorporating Maker Growth CU solve this? Hence, these players would deal directly with Growth CU and said CU would provide the KYC/AML requirements needed by the institutions. After all these vaults need to be exclusive and whitelisted via a smart contract, right?

I think the institutional asks here mirror what other projects going the “Pro” route (Aave, Compound) have experienced. Having worked with large financial institutions in the past,  I’d say the KYC focus stems from regulatory (mostly bank secrecy act though also more general reasons) but is driven expressly by internal US domestic legal and, principally, compliance concerns re various risks, including reputational. Compliance more likely than not will be the most cumbersome hill to climb.

But, have you noticed that the big hacks, often use DAI as a currency of liquidation, and not only that, many users who love their privacy and anonymity use DAI. Don’t you think that making KYC is a kick to the principle of DAI being a currency for all?

You don’t need to do KYC to use Dai so I don’t think it will have an impact. Also, looking at how the market responds positively to AAVE and Compound’s move, I don’t think there will be backlash like you are mentioning.
And tbh, whatever we do, haters gonna hate

Rune gave a good interview somewhat on this topic recently (on the Defiant)  where he basically said that keeping the Protocol open and permissionless was key to growth and further innovation in contrast to a centralized team creating whitelisting “pro” products exclusively. I agree with this approach as it permits both Dai to remain a permissionless user generated currency open to all while allowing different community members the option of creating their businesses thereon. For what it’s worth,  there certainly is a commercial opportunity to create a VASP on top of the Protocol (Nexo has done that by borrowing and lending to its clients for a profit), which would require KYC for its clients.

discourse_list.title: Growth CU weekly update: September 10 - September 16

content.content: General Updates  ETHOnline Tell your hacker friends at ETHOnline we have an 8000 DAI prize for the teams that implement:   An auction keeper implementation to further decentralize and democratize auction participation.   A GUI for PSM on IPFS and/or PSM bridge: So we could link our PSM’s and do any type of swap we are capable of doing. A user that has Pax, for example, could swap to USDC or vice versa by just paying the tin to get Dai, and then in the same transaction, it would put Dai into the other PSM and getting the token. The tout is zero going out anyways.   A furocombo-like web for arbitrage with PSM and Flash Mint.   An optimistic roll up test environment to facilitate the testing of L2 code. Extra points for leveraging Dapptools.    @Jenn  at Mainnet2021 talking about all that’s happening in MakerDAO, send her a message if you are in NY  oh, and if you want to go, we have a discount code for you: spkr-gst  twitter.com    jenn @jensenhaji    Come say hi and hear what @MakerDAO has been up to at Messari #Mainnet2021 https://t.co/iGCmMmW1qA   9:38 PM - 11 Sep 2021           26                7              Star-s- of the week     The Lunacian Scholarship League first cup will be on September 25th and DAI will be the LSL Season 2 official stablecoin, the LSL is the Axie Infinity biggest tournament for scholarships. https://twitter.com/lsl_gg/status/1433402830765781000   We closed a partnership with Community Gaming to run together a series of tournaments from now until the end of this year. These tournaments are for different games and gaming communities and include streamers, and a big push on social networks. shout-out to @Lozadaluis12    Tweet of the Week   twitter.com    MakerDAO Growth @MakerGrowth    1/11  We have just started streaming salaries to our team members with @Superfluid_HQ, the token standard for programmable money streams on Ethereum😎  Automated admin and better working conditions: If you have long term contributors it's a no brainer. Let's check how it works 👇 https://t.co/cLOSoNZPoJ   7:59 PM - 14 Sep 2021           180                39             August PnL  image1038×1108 114 KB

discourse_list.title: Growth CU weekly update: September 3 - September 9

content.content: General Updates  Onboarding new stablecoins to the PSM We are having conversations with other stablecoin providers (GUSD, FEI, UST) and working with them on an onboarding proposal. Instead of them being just a PSM collateral, we are developing a partnership where both sides are committed to working together in a long-term relationship. At the same time, we are reaching out to all aggregators to push the PSM-USDP integration.  ETHOnline We are sponsoring the ETHOnline hackathon, which starts next week with a technical workshop with @liberuum  from SES and officially kicks off on Friday - September 17th. For this hackathon, we will be giving prizes to the best integrations with the Maker Protocol. We are thinking about specific Prize names, but please leave a comment with your suggestions if you have an idea.  Welcome Feli to the fam!! @zxMori  is our Integrations Lead. He will be helping our partners to interact with the Maker Protocol. Felipe has been working as a Software Engineer for about five years, he started with crypto development right before the 2017 ATH. He has worked in several parts of the crypto ecosystem, getting to know a few prominent protocols inside out, like AAVE, Compound, The Graph, and Chainlink. We are very excited to have him on our team!! If you want to say hi to him, you can find him on RocketChat: @mori or Twitter: @fmorisan   Star-s of the week     MKR is now available on the Blockchain.com Exchange.   The Fixed income plan for Dai is now available in Bitbns.  1081×1081 95.8 KB    @MarianoDP  participated in a panel with NAOS, Lithium Finance and Huobi about RWAs and Stablecoins for the Asian market   And he also collaborated with NAOS in this Cointelegraph article    Tweet of the Week   twitter.com    MakerDAO Growth @MakerGrowth    1/10  Let's make a swap. We have PAX $USDP and want $DAI  Oops! What a big slippage between two stablecoin prices at @matchaxyz!  But wait a minute... PAX was added into the PSM in the Aug 20 Executive Vote at Maker!  ➡️ vote.makerdao.com/executive/temp… https://t.co/BkR6fkDwWZ   6:37 PM - 7 Sep 2021           24                6
This might not be the best thread for my comment, but any progress on integrating the DAI-USDP PSM into the DAI-USDC UI?

@Tosh9.0 My understanding is that we’ll be pushing for PSM integrations into existing DEX aggregators, like 1inch, in order to give them more visibility to the wider DeFi community. Would this be right @Nadia ? Keep in mind I’m still pretty new to the Growth CU. I might be wrong here
yes that’s right @zxMori

Interesting – will that be done in parallel to or instead of having the DAI-USDP PSM available on the current DAI-USDC PSM UI? @zxMori I don’t have an opinion either way (the former might be preferable alone) and am just curious.
@smaugho and dSpot will be adding the DAI-USDP PSM to the existing UI (though I think technically it’ll be a new UI with both of them, due to how IPFS works.)

PAX was added and it is deployed in https://ipfs.io/ipfs/QmXRmkz1NmKZ72NAFQv2qoqUzsXrvCRjLjnm3BjTeMzvRi/ Though we kept the name as PAX (and not USDP). Can be changed (and re-upload to IPFS), but our PSM will continue being called PSM-PAX-A I think, wonder if renaming to USDP could cause confusion?
